title: Cathleen Synge Morawetz
summary: Cathleen Synge Morawetz (May 5, 1923 â€“ August 8, 2017) was a Canadian mathematician who spent much of her career in the United States.[1] Morawetz's research was mainly in the study of the partial differential equations governing fluid flow, particularly those of mixed type occurring in transonic flow.[2] She was professor emerita at the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences at the New York University, where she had also served as director from 1984 to 1988.[3] She was awarded the National Medal of Science in 1998.[4]
